package.headline: The Ultimate BBQ Checklist: Host the Perfect Backyard Gathering for Kids and Adults
package.dek: Transform your backyard into the ultimate entertaining space with this step-by-step guide to grilling success
package.storyline: Guide home hosts through creating the perfect BBQ experience for mixed crowds (kids + adults)

sections.heading: Pre-Party Planning (48 Hours Before)
sections.body: Start by creating your guest list and menu. Consider dietary restrictions and age groups. Plan your shopping list around crowd-pleasers: burgers and hot dogs for kids, plus elevated options like marinated chicken or vegetable skewers for adults. Don't forget sides that work at room temperature.

sections.heading: Grill Setup and Heat Zones
sections.body: The secret to BBQ success lies in mastering heat zones. Create a two-zone fire: high heat for searing and low heat for gentle cooking. This technique lets you handle multiple foods simultaneously while preventing overcooking. Test your zones with the hand method - high heat allows 2-3 seconds of hand-hovering, medium allows 4-5 seconds.

sections.heading: The Essential Grilling Timeline
sections.body: Start with items that take longest: thick cuts of meat first, then chicken, followed by burgers and hot dogs. Remember that resting the meat for 5-10 minutes after cooking allows juices to redistribute, ensuring every bite is perfectly tender. Use this time to warm buns and prep final garnishes.

sections.heading: Kid-Friendly Zone Setup
sections.body: Create a dedicated space away from the grill with activities and easy-to-eat foods. Pre-cut fruits, cheese cubes, and individual drink cups prevent spills and keep little ones happy while adults enjoy the main event.

sections.heading: Finishing Touches That Wow
sections.body: Presentation matters. Use colorful plates, set up a DIY topping station, and create ambient lighting with string lights or lanterns. These details transform a simple cookout into a memorable gathering that guests will talk about long after the last burger is served.
